question:
Program Name: English as a Second Language (ESL)
Code: R901
Credential: George Brown College Certificate
Method of Study: Part-time
Duration: Students must complete the program within three consecutive academic years.
Available Terms: January, March, May, July, September, November
Location: St. James Campus

This is an accelerated hybrid English as a Second Language (ESL) program designed to help develop English language skills for personal, professional, and academic purposes. The program consists of eight levels, ranging from beginner to advanced. Each level lasts for six weeks. In addition, students can choose elective courses tailored to their unique needs for a personalized learning experience. Currently, the program is being delivered in a hybrid format that includes both in-person and online instruction.

This non-credit ESL program offers English language instruction from beginner to advanced levels. Completed courses in this program can be applied towards George Brown College's full-time English program.

Please note: This program is not eligible for study permits. Students who require a study permit should consider enrolling in a full-time ESL program instead.

Term Availability:
- Fall 2024: Continuous Open Enrollment
- Winter 2025: Continuous Open Enrolment
- Spring 2025: Continuous Open Enrolment?

context:
The text is about the English as a Second Language (ESL) Part-Time Certificate program offered by George Brown College. Students can complete ESL courses which count towards the full-time English for Academic Purposes (EAP) program, reducing the number of EAP courses needed to complete that certificate. Each ESL course is six weeks long and includes 50 hours of teaching and learning. The program offers a hybrid approach with both online and in-person instruction, and students will improve their reading, writing, listening, and speaking skills through interactive classes, independent studies, and assessments. Students will need access to a computer with an Internet connection, a working camera, and a microphone for online classes. The in-person classes are held at the School of English as a Second Language located at 341 King Street East (Building H, St. James Campus), and online classes are delivered through Zoom. Students will receive regular feedback and support from their instructors, as well as access to customized online learning resources and academic resources offered by George Brown's Tutoring and Learning Centre. Free tutoring and peer-led workshops are also organized by the Student Success.

Note: ESL courses do not count as credit towards other George Brown programs.

Program Details:
- Hybrid approach with accelerated in-person and online instruction
- Dynamic schedule with one week in-person followed by one week of combined instruction
- Independent weekly studies to sharpen skills
- Six weeks long, 50 hours each
- Interactive in-person sessions and online lessons
- Elective courses available (additional fees apply)
- In-class assessments

Delivery:
- In-person classes held at George Brown College, School of English as a Second Language
- Online classes delivered through Zoom
- Independent weekly studies completed asynchronously

Supports:
- Regular feedback and support from instructors
- Access to customized online learning resources
- Access to academic resources offered by George Brownâ€™s Tutoring and Learning Centre
- Free tutoring and peer-led workshops organized by Student Success.
question:
Title: ESL Part-Time Certificate Program at George Brown College: Flexible, Hybrid Approach for English Language Learners

The ESL Part-Time Certificate program offered by George Brown College provides an excellent opportunity for individuals looking to improve their English language skills in a flexible and hybrid learning environment. This certificate program allows students to complete certain ESL courses that count towards the full-time English for Academic Purposes (EAP) program, reducing the number of EAP courses needed to earn the certificate.

Program Features:
1. Accelerated Hybrid Learning: The program offers a hybrid approach, with one week of in-person instruction followed by one week of combined online and independent learning. Students can attend in-person sessions at George Brown College's School of English as a Second Language and participate in online classes using Zoom for additional flexibility.
2. Dynamic Schedule: With this schedule, students can balance their personal commitments while progressing towards their language goals. Each ESL course lasts six weeks and consists of 50 hours of teaching and learning.
3. Interactive Learning Environment: The program combines engaging in-person sessions with independent weekly studies to help learners effectively sharpen their reading, writing, listening, and speaking skills. Students will enjoy interactive classes that encourage active participation, as well as assessments designed to monitor their progress.
4. Customized Online Learning Resources: The ESL Part-Time Certificate program provides students with access to customized online learning resources tailored to their language needs. These resources help reinforce concepts taught during in-person and online classes, allowing learners to practice at their own pace and schedule.
5. Academic Support Services: George Brown College offers academic support services through its Tutoring and Learning Centre for students enrolled in the ESL Part-Time Certificate program. Additionally, free tutoring and peer-led workshops are organized by Student Success to help learners get the most out of their studies.

Requirements for Participation:
To attend the in-person classes at George Brown College, students need access to a computer with an Internet connection, a working camera, and a microphone for online participation. This is essential since some classes will be delivered through Zoom. The School of English as a Second Language for ESL Part-Time Certificate program is located at 341 King Street East (Building H, St. James Campus).

Important Information:
ESL courses taken as part of the Part-Time Certificate program do not count towards other George Brown programs. Students who aim to pursue further education at the college should consider enrolling in the full-time English for Academic Purposes (EAP) program to meet the language requirements for their desired course of study.

In conclusion, the ESL Part-Time Certificate program offered by George Brown College is an excellent choice for individuals seeking a flexible and hybrid learning approach to improving their English language skills. The accelerated schedule, customized online resources, academic support services, and dynamic learning environment make this an attractive option for students looking to balance their personal lives while making progress towards their language goals.?

4. Electives: ESL 9073, Advanced Grammar and Composition Skills; ESL 9064, Listening and Persuasive Speech; ESL 9078, Academic Preparation for College/University Studies; ESL 9069, Advanced Essay Writing; ESL 9063, IELTS General Training Module; ESL 9077, IELTS Exam Preparation; ESL 9085, CELPIP â€“ General Test Preparation; ESL 9090, Successful Conversation; ESL 9088, Introduction to Business Communication.
5. Course fees: Ranges from $226.00 to $382.00 for courses and workshops, and $284.00 to $371.00 for electives.

context:
* The program mentioned is Business Communication.
* The estimated total cost for one course in the program starting in Fall 2023 is $371.00.
* The tuition fees are subject to change for programs starting in Fall 2024 and at later dates.
* Financial assistance for this program is not eligible for OSAP funding.
* New students applying to the program must take a level placement test and start from the level based on the placement test results.
* Alternatively, students who have completed an ESL course at George Brown College within the last six months can apply to start at the next level without having to complete a placement test.
* Students must achieve a grade of B (73%) or better to successfully complete each course.
* To achieve the certificate, students must complete at least five (5) ESL courses and ESL 9068 (ESL IIIB ADVANCED).
* Registration for the level placement test can be done by visiting Continuing Education (partâ€“time) ESL Program Placement Test Registration.

Title: Business Communication Program - ESL Course Information

The Business Communication program at George Brown College offers ESL courses for students who need to improve their English language skills in order to succeed in the business communication field. Here is some important information regarding these ESL courses:

* The specific program mentioned is Business Communication.
* The estimated total cost for one course in the program starting in Fall 2023 is $371.00.
* Tuition fees are subject to change for programs starting in Fall 2024 and at later dates.
* Financial assistance for this program is not eligible for OSAP funding.
* New students applying to the program must take a level placement test and start from the level based on the placement test results.
* Students who have completed an ESL course at George Brown College within the last six months can apply to start at the next level without having to complete a placement test.
* To successfully complete each course, students must achieve a grade of B (73%) or better.
* To earn the certificate, students must complete at least five (5) ESL courses and ESL 9068 (ESL IIIB ADVANCED).
* Registration for the level placement test can be done by visiting Continuing Education (partâ€“time) ESL Program Placement Test Registration.?

context:
To register for the ESL Program Placement Test, domestic and international students should visit the Courses section on the George Brown College website and register directly in their respective courses. International students of R901 program do not need to apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.

For more information, contact the English for Academic Purposes office at 416-415-5000, ext. 4826 or email conedesl@georgebrown.ca. The virtual tour of the campus can be accessed on the website. For details about other programs and life at George Brown, sign up to receive tailored resources.

The text also mentions that courses in this program are for continuing education purposes only. Domestic students should visit the English for Academic Purposes Program (R105), while international students should visit the English for Academic Purposes Program (R115).

- English for Academic Purposes office: 416-415-5000, ext. 4826 or email conedesl@georgebrown.ca.
question:
Title: George Brown College - English for Academic Purposes (EAP) Program for International Students in R901 (Domestic students refer to R115)

George Brown College offers an English for Academic Purposes (EAP) program specifically designed for international students enrolled in the R901 program. This program aims to help students develop the necessary English language skills to succeed academically and professionally. Students will improve their reading, writing, speaking, and listening abilities through a variety of interactive courses.

Domestic students should apply to the English for Academic Purposes Program (R105), while international students should not use the George Brown College Online Application System but instead register directly in their respective courses on the Courses section of the George Brown College website. Students do not need to take the ESL Program Placement Test if they have already taken an approved English language proficiency test like IELTS or TOEFL.

For more information about the EAP program, contact the English for Academic Purposes office at 416-415-5000, ext. 4826 or email conedesl@georgebrown.ca. Students can also explore the campus virtually through a virtual tour accessible on the website. For details about other programs and life at George Brown, sign up to receive tailored resources.

Please note that courses in this program are for continuing education purposes only. Domestic students should visit the English for Academic Purposes Program (R105), while international students should visit the English for Academic Purposes Program (R115) on the George Brown College website for more information.

Contact Information:
- Contact Centre: 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance at 1-800-265-2002
- English for Academic Purposes office: 416-415-5000, ext. 4826 or email conedesl@georgebrown.ca.?
